lexUnit.name: rush.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of air or a liquid) flow strongly.

sentence.text: The windpipe and vocal cords then snap open and the air rushes out .
Mr Telford , of Wheatley , Doncaster , could hear appeals to give himself up -- but his replies were drowned by the noise of air rushing down the shaft .
The bee gauges its speed of flight from the amount its antennae are bent outwards by the air rushing past .
As the air rushed from her lungs , so his spunk flooded her innards .
Cold night air rushed in , ruffling her hair and making her eyes water .
She sprawled flat on the hard wooden floor , her cry abruptly silenced as all the air rushed out of her body .
The blood rushed to Erika 's face .
Your face will become pinker because of increased blood circulation -- when masks dry , they ` pinch " the skin and blood tends to rush to the surface .
Blood rushed into the housekeeper 's pale face .
There was silence for a moment , a silence so deep and intense that she could hear her own heart beating , almost hear the flow of blood rushing through her veins .
Perhaps swollen by rain , the river rushed into the sea in a torrent of white foam and spray .
There is a large , calm pool , below the bridge ; then the river narrows , rushing quickly through a rapid stream into a broad , smooth run .
Not far away a turgid and fast moving river rushed southward in narrow gorges .
We had to climb what seemed a never-ending staircase to a high platform where we took our seats in a punt at the top of a slide having water rushing down it .
We arrived at an other dam around noon ; water was rushing over the huge rocks and it was too risky to try to paddle across so the canoes were lined across .
She stood on the deck while the water rushed in through the sides of the great oaken gates , lifting the barge higher and higher until they were level with the water in the next basin .
Water rushed across the road to the Nile Hotel , carrying scorpions and reptiles into the drowning rooms .
Outside there was the noise of water rushing along gutters inadequate to their task .
The stream is rushing , running over the gravel ,
